Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders

Class EntityViewFactoryBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders.AbstractWritableAttributesBuilder<EntityViewFactory>
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders.EntityViewFactoryBuilder
Direct Known Subclasses:
EntityListViewFactoryBuilder
@Component("entityViewFactoryBuilder") @Primary @Scope("prototype") public class EntityViewFactoryBuilder extends AbstractWritableAttributesBuilder<EntityViewFactory>
Builder for creating a single EntityViewFactory. Supports configuring default processors on a DispatchingEntityViewFactory. If a custom factory type is being used, most properties will have no effect.
Since:
2.0.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme
See Also:
  • DispatchingEntityViewFactory
  • DefaultEntityViewFactory

    • factory

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder factory(@NonNull @NonNull EntityViewFactory factory)
      Configure the specific EntityViewFactory that should be used for this view. This will take precedence over a registered factoryType(Class).

      NOTE that the factory will most likely be modified by this builder, so only use prototype instances.

      Parameters:
      factory - to use
      Returns:
      current builder

    • transactionManager

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder transactionManager(String transactionManagerName)
      Set the name of the PlatformTransactionManager bean that should be used by the DispatchingEntityViewFactory. If null, will remove any previously registered transaction manager.

      This setting will simply be ignored if:

      • the EntityViewFactory is not a DispatchingEntityViewFactory
      • there is no TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry
      • there is no PlatformTransactionManager with that name in the bean factory
      Parameters:
      transactionManagerName - bean name
      Returns:
      current builder
      See Also:
      • TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry

    • transactionManager

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder transactionManager(org.springframework.transaction.PlatformTransactionManager transactionManager)
      Set the PlatformTransactionManager bean that should be used by the DispatchingEntityViewFactory. If null, will remove any previously registered transaction manager. If the EntityViewFactory is not a DispatchingEntityViewFactory or does not have a TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry, this setting will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      transactionManager - to use
      Returns:
      current builder
      See Also:
      • TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry

    • transactionTemplate

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder transactionTemplate(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate transactionTemplate)
      Set the TransactionTemplate bean that should be used by the DispatchingEntityViewFactory. If null, will remove any previously registered transaction template. If the EntityViewFactory is not a DispatchingEntityViewFactory or does not have a TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry, this setting will be ignored.

      Use this method if you want to deviate from the default transaction settings, else it should be sufficient to simply specify the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

      Parameters:
      transactionTemplate - to use
      Returns:
      current builder
      See Also:
      • TransactionalEntityViewProcessorRegistry
      • transactionManager(String)
      • transactionManager(PlatformTransactionManager)

    • propertyRegistry

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder propertyRegistry(EntityPropertyRegistry propertyRegistry)
      Set the property registry that should be attached to this view. Will add a EntityPropertyRegistryViewProcessor. This is required before a property registry can be customized using properties(Consumer).
      Parameters:
      propertyRegistry - to attach
      Returns:
      current builder

    • viewProcessor

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder viewProcessor(@NonNull @NonNull Consumer<EntityViewProcessorConfigurer<? extends EntityViewProcessor>> processorConfigurer)
      Configure a new or customize an existing EntityViewProcessor. Allows detailed setting of how the processor configuration should be applied.

      The initial EntityViewProcessorConfigurer will be configured with an appropriate AutowireCapableBeanFactory.

      Parameters:
      processorConfigurer - to customize
      Returns:
      current builder

    • postProcess

      @Deprecated public <U extends EntityViewProcessor> EntityViewFactoryBuilder postProcess(@NonNull @NonNull Class<U> viewProcessorType, @NonNull @NonNull Consumer<U> postProcessor)
      Deprecated.
      since 4.0.0 - use viewProcessor(Consumer) instead
      Add a post processor for a single EntityViewProcessor with the default name determined by its implementing class. Shortcut for easy post-processing of the default EntityViewProcessors.

      Deprecated method: use viewProcessor( vp -> vp.withType( viewProcessorType ).deferred().skipIfMissing() instead.

      Type Parameters:
      U - type of the view processor
      Parameters:
      viewProcessorType - type of the view processor (will determine its name)
      postProcessor - post processor
      Returns:
      current builder

    • postProcess

      @Deprecated public <U extends EntityViewProcessor> EntityViewFactoryBuilder postProcess(@NonNull @NonNull String viewProcessorName, @NonNull @NonNull Class<U> viewProcessorType, @NonNull @NonNull Consumer<U> postProcessor)
      Deprecated.
      since 4.0.0 - use viewProcessor(Consumer) instead
      Add a post processor for a single EntityViewProcessor. Shortcut for easy post-processing of the default EntityViewProcessors.

      Deprecated method: use viewProcessor( vp -> vp.withName( viewProcessorName ).withType( viewProcessorType ).deferred().skipIfMissing() instead.

      Type Parameters:
      U - type of the view processor
      Parameters:
      viewProcessorName - name of the view processor
      viewProcessorType - expected type of the view processor
      postProcessor - post processor
      Returns:
      current builder

    • postProcess

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder postProcess(@NonNull @NonNull BiConsumer<EntityViewFactory,EntityViewProcessorRegistry> postProcessor)
      Add a post processor for this entire view factory. If the view factory is not of type DispatchingEntityViewFactory, the second parameter (EntityViewProcessorRegistry) will be null.

      Use this method if you want to make global modifications like changing the EntityViewProcessor ordering.

      The post processors will be called after general building.

      Parameters:
      postProcessor - post processor
      Returns:
      current builder

    • and

      public EntityViewFactoryBuilder and(@NonNull @NonNull Consumer<EntityViewFactoryBuilder> consumer)
      Apply an additional consumer to this builder.
      Parameters:
      consumer - to apply
      Returns:
      current builder

    • build

      public EntityViewFactory build()
      Build a new factory instance of the type configured using factoryType(Class). If no factoryType(Class) has been configured, an exception will be thrown.
      Returns:
      factory instance
